p: S. alata (L.) Roxb. is a flowering shrub of the Fabaceae family. It has the name “candle bush” owing to the framework of its inflorescences [ 34]. It is an annual and occasionally biannual herb, with an average height of 1 to 4 m, burgeoning in sunlit and humid zones. The leaves are oblong, with 5 to 14 leaflet sets, robust petioles (2 to 3 mm), caduceus bracts (2 × 3 by 1 × 2 cm), and dense flowers (20 × 50 by 3 × 4 cm). Zygomorphic flowers have bright yellow color with 7 stamens and a pubertal ovary. The fruit exists as a 10 to 16 × 1.5 cm tetragonal pod, thick, flattened wings, brown when ripe with many diamond-shaped brown seeds. It is propagated by seeds and dispersed to about 1,500 m above the sea level [ 35, 36].
